use: Should get Discipline if you are a Phoenix Clan Player
designernotes: A Phoenix Shugenja blasting his enemies with fire.

text:
If you are a Phoenix Clan player, this Strategy has Discipline :g1:.

designernotes: A detachment of unicorn Cavalry, being led by Moto Naleesh, smashing into the flank of an enemy unit. Her horse is trampling helpless infantry soldiers underfoot. Shinjo Min-hee is at her left side and Utaku Liu-Xeung at her right.

text:

Courtesy: This Strategy's Ranged Attack has +1 strength. (Courtesy traits do not take effect if you went first.)

designernotes: Doji Dainagon and Doji Makoto meet privately with Shosuro Makiko and Bayushi Nitoshi to form their clan's alliance against the Otomo.

text:
Battle: Fear 3 (Bow a target enemy Follower or Personality without Followers with 3 or lower Force).
Battle: Bow one to four target enemy Personalities, each with 4 or lower Gold Cost and with a total combined Gold Cost of 8 or less.
title: Scour the Unworthy

flavor: Every choice he made was already made for him. From the moment the ambush began, his fate was predetermined.
designernotes: A courtier innocently going to some remote place, not seeing the myriad of ninjas hiding around him.

text: Ninja Battle: Give a target enemy Personality a -1F/-1C Poison token. Straighten your Sensei; you may use its abilities again this turn. You may target and bow your unbowed Ninja to give the Personality an additional -1F/-1C Poison token after each time your Ninja action resolves that targeted him, not including this one. Lose 2 Honor.
title: Spinning the Web

flavor: "There are many ways of disrupting the opponent's balance. First, attack his spirit with your voice. The blade follows shortly after." - Akodo's Leadership
designernotes: Bloody and exhausted soldiers bravely charge an enemy position, being struck down by arrows and magic as they shout and run forward.

text:
Battle: Give a target enemy Personality -2F.
Battle: Give a target enemy Personality with 6 or more Force -4F. You may take an additional action.
title: Startling Kiai

flavor: "Break this line? No, I do not think you shall."
designernotes: Samurai using a war fan to direct large scale troop movements.

text: Battle: Give a target enemy Follower or Personality a Force penalty equal to your target unbowed Follower's Force. If that Follower is attached to a Commander, you may bow it to draw a card and take an additional action.
title: Superior Defense

flavor: Maintaining a kneeling position for hours, despite the physical discomfort, is often used as a test of character by whimsical lords.
designernotes: A samurai presenting himself to his lord for judgment.

text: Political Open: Target a Human Personality. He must undergo a test of character. Discard the top card of his controller's Fate Deck. If the Focus Value is greater than or equal to the target's Personal Honor, dishonor him and draw a card.
title: Test of Character

flavor: "It seems the monk was not jesting when he said we cannot pass."

text:
Earth Open: If you don't have a Ring in play, target three Personalities controlled by the active player. He must declare an attack this turn and assign at least one of them, if able.
Earth Open: Give your Provinces +2 strength for each Ring you control (this turn).
title: Walking with the Earth

flavor: "The designs of the kami are majestic, of that there is no doubt. It can be difficult to endure their beauty, though."

text:
Battle/Open: Straighten your target Ring.
Fire Interrupt: Bow your target unbowed Ring. After revealing focused cards in a duel created by the action, give the first card you focused in the duel +2FV.
title: Walking with the Fire

flavor: To be subjected to a search is an utter humiliation. It implies that one's word, one's honor, is not good enough.
designernotes: A Magistrate publicly accusing a samurai.

text: Political Open: Give another player's target Personality -2F. You may target and bow your unbowed Magistrate to dishonor the Personality.
title: Warranted Search

flavor: "Accept Daigotsu's blessing if you require it, lackey," Tetsuo sneered at the Kokujin monk. "I need not his strength to perform his will. My strength is sufficient."
designernotes: Art: Tetsuo, assuming he is still alive at this point, striking a fierce stance. Across from him, also in a pose ready for combat, is a Kokujin Monk (either Kuchika or Dairu from TNO), clearly embracing to powers of their Shadowlands Taint.)

text: Kiho Battle: Straighten your target Monk or Shugenja, or negate his current Force penalties. You may target and bow an enemy Shadowlands card without attachments.
title: A Breed Apart

flavor:
"You will make a fine Emperor, my brother."
"You would have as well."
designernotes: One Heir forgives the other. We don't know which forgives which, so the art should be ambiguous in this respect.

text: Open, :g2:: Discard a card to search your Fate deck for a card and put it in your hand.
title: Accepting the Choice

flavor: Kodo bowed, touching her head to the floor. "I will serve you well, Minori-sama. This is my vow." Kneeling, her smile was concealed.
designernotes: Art: Agasha Kodo accepting the advisor appointment from Yoritomo Minori. She has a sly smile on her face, like she is going to take advantage of this to do something sinister.

text: Economic Open: Target your unbowed Personality. Straighten a target Holding that has not produced Gold this turn. If you targeted a Courtier or Phoenix Clan Personality, give the Holding +1GP (this turn).
title: Amethyst Adjunct

flavor: The home is a sacred place in Rokugan. It is a samurai's sanctuary, a place of introspection and harmony. To invite a guest is a gesture of trust. So is honoring the invitation.
designernotes: [Note: Someone of another Clan is being hosted.]

text: Interrupt: Permanently give +1PH to a target Personality the action is Recruiting. You may Proclaim him even if he does not have your Clan Alignment.
title: An Honored Guest

flavor: Samurai are always eager to test their skills in single combat, and on the field of war there is no need for the niceties of dueling protocol.
designernotes: One duelist destroying another's Weapon in a duel.

text: Iaijutsu Battle: Your target unbowed Personality challenges a target enemy Personality. Bow the loser. The winner gains 2 Honor.
title: Battlefield Challenge

flavor: "Speak to me again, cur, and it will cost you your tongue, if not your life."

text:
Courtesy: Discipline :g2:. (Courtesy traits do not take effect if you went first.)
Political Interrupt: If the action is a Favor action, negate Personalities' movement home from its effects.
title: Be Silent!

flavor: "I can only imagine why you might seek the company of such scum, Shosuro-san."
designernotes: [Note: A Magistrate arresting a criminal. SO ORIGINAL!]

text: Open: Bow your target unbowed Personality. Target another player's Personality. Gain 1 Honor. If your Personality is a Magistrate, draw a card if the other target has lower Personal Honor, and straighten your Personality if the other target is dishonorable.
title: Caught Among Thieves

flavor: "Not today, vile enemies." She laughed as they coughed and cursed. The tricks of the Scorpion Clan were not completely without merit.
designernotes: A Spider Ninja fleeing from a scene after knocking his pursuers out.

text:
Courtesy: This card's ability has no Gold Cost. (Courtesy traits do not take effect if you went first.)
Battle, :g1:: Bow a target enemy card; if the target has any attachments, they must be bowed.
title: Confounding Departure

flavor: Power flooded through Kanpeki's form, filling him with a strength he had never dreamt of. "Father!" he shouted. "I will strike them down in your name, father!"
designernotes: A shadow-corrupted samurai kneeling in his home, his murdered family laying all around him, dead by his hand.

text: Ninja Battle: Give a target enemy Personality -1F for each Ninja Personality in your army. If the target now has 0 Force or no abilities, you may take an additional action.
title: Darkness Inside

flavor: The expansion of the Empire exposed its people to new forms of life.
designernotes: A VERY dense jungle.

text:
After this Terrain leaves play, straighten the Personalities it bowed.
Battle: Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play. Starting with you, each player targets and bows one of his unbowed Personalities at this battlefield.
title: Dense Jungle

flavor: The struggle to defeat the treacherous Spider was made more difficult by disputes of precedence between the clan forces. Kanpeki's followers took full advantage. - Otomo Hiroshi, The Final Days, fourth scroll
designernotes: Art: A Phoenix and a Unicorn general arguing on the field of battle, shouting angrily at each other. Their troops wait behind them in perfect formation, anxiously waiting to be let loose.

text: Battle/Engage: Give a target attacking Personality -3F. Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play.
title: Dissension in Command

flavor: "Sometimes a target's very alertness can be turned against him." - Unknown Shosuro sensei
designernotes: Art: A paranoid Lion Samurai walking the streets of the Second City at night. He nervously looks at the shadows, waiting to be attacked, but he does not see the Ninja on the rooftop above him that is ready to strike.

text: Ninja Battle: Bow a target enemy card with a Poison token or without abilities.
title: Distracting Paranoia

flavor: "Have you sometimes suspected that your own thoughts are the enemy?" - Togashi Shao
designernotes: A samurai defeating their opponent by achieving peace of mind.

text: Battle: Give a target enemy Personality -2F, or -4F if his controller had more cards in hand than you before you played this card.
title: Immaterial Weapons

flavor: In the end, it was only proper for the Spider to have disappeared in advance. The charge of their enemies, had they remained, would have devastated them.
designernotes: Art: Moto Taigo on his horse in front of a regiment of Unicorn cavalry. He is calling out for the charge, and his forces seem eager to head towards the enemy.

text: Battle: Target your Personality. Fear equal to the Force of his target Follower. If your Personality is a Commander, negate the next straightening of any card bowed by this Fear effect.
title: Inexorable Advance

flavor: "I will use my smaller axe, just out of respect for your obviously inferior weaponry."
designernotes: A Follower is sent to intimidate an adversary.

text: Open: Bow your target unbowed Follower. Make a Fear effect equal to its Force. If your Follower's Personality is a Commander, the Fear destroys Followers after it bows them.
title: Intimidation Tactic

flavor: "My dearest Tselu has done all that I could ask and more as my Ivory Champion. Will you be equal to his example, Shizuka?" The Scorpion's eyes twinkled. "You will be amazed, my lady."
designernotes: Art: Shizuka smiles in court chambers as she stands at the side of the seated Governess.

text:
Invest :g2:: If you are Scorpion Clan, draw a card.
Battle/Open: Dishonor a target Personality. You may take an additional action.
title: Ivory Ascendance

flavor: "As the bonsai must be pruned to flourish, so too must the Empire be managed. The time has come for the Spider to be sheared away. It is simply the way of things."
designernotes: [Note: A Monk meditating, clearing his mind of worldly thoughts.]

text:
Open: Put this Kata into play. Discard your other Kata in play.
Open, :bow:: Put a target Kharmic card in your Fate discard pile into your hand. Discard a card.
title: Kharma's First Form

flavor: Sometimes it is better to sacrifice the cart in order to save the ox.
designernotes: A wall of the city being abandoned.

text: Siege Absent Battle: Give your target Fortification Expendable. Straighten it if your current army is opposed. Gain 1 Honor after it is destroyed during battle resolution. You may take an additional action. (Absent actions may be taken without presence.)
title: Leave It Abandoned

flavor: "You could number a thousand, but if only two of you can face me at a time, you will never pass."
designernotes: A Samurai holding a narrow path by himself, as his opponents can only attack him one at a time.

text:
While there is only one Personality in the defending army, he has Force and Chi bonuses equal to the number of units in the attacking army and has Resilient.
Battle: Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play.
title: Narrow Passage

flavor: "An arrow like this killed me once," Endo sneered. "As you can see, it did not stop me then. It will not stop me now."
designernotes: An arrow lodging in a Spider warrior leg, crippling him.

text: Battle: Ranged 1 Attack (Destroy a target enemy Follower or Personality without Followers with 1 or lower Force). After this destroys a card, draw a card.
title: Not the End

flavor: The merest hint of Taint is sufficient to end careers. But what happens when gossip is based on truth?
designernotes: Art: Susumu Takuan looking astonished at the announcement of a high ranking court official, as other courtiers look on with horrified expressions. Not sure how specific we want to be on the person making the announcement, since we are not sure which Heir is responsible at this point.

text: Political Open: Target a non-Shadowlands Personality whose player also controls a Shadowlands card. You accuse the target of consorting with the enemy. The Personality's controller may bow him. If he does not bow, dishonor him and draw a card.
title: Ominous Rumors

flavor: Kichi's eyes stared upward, sightless. "Power consumes those who cannot wield it properly," Yogo Ameiko said, smirking. "Innocent little fox, you never had a chance."
designernotes: The new Scorpion Onyx Champion.

text: Maho Battle: Destroy your target unbowed Follower or Personality. Destroy a target enemy card without attachments and lower or equal Gold Cost. Create a 2F/2C/0PH Nonhuman • Shadowlands • Undead Personality at the current battlefield. Lose 2 Honor unless you are Scorpion Clan.
title: Onyx Ascendance

flavor: Tamahime regarded her new station with bemusement. "This will do."

text:
These actions have Absent if they target a Cavalry card or you ever had presence at the current battlefield.
Battle: Negate a target card's current Force bonuses or penalties (your choice).
Battle: Negate the current Province's current strength bonuses or penalties (your choice).
title: Ruby Ascendance

flavor: "Our sensei have pitted us against one another. I believe it may be some manner of wager." - Petals and Pincer, V
designernotes: Bayushi Fuyuko leans close to Doji Natsuyo and whispers suggestively to her from behind a fan, while Natsuyo looks nervous. Pincer and Petal.

text:
Invest :g3:: Before you draw cards at the end of the turn, put this card into your hand from the discard pile.
Political Open: Permanently give your target Courtier Expendable and the trait, "After another player's action targets this card, gain 1 Honor."
title: Secret Alliances

flavor: A sudden torrent of water knocked the soldiers down before they could draw their blades. "There will be no need for steel today," she said with a laugh.

text: Kiho Water Battle: Target your unbowed Monk or Shugenja and give one or two target enemy Followers or Personalities -2F. Bow each enemy target that now has 0 Force.
title: Strength of the Torrent

flavor: Their treachery exposed, the Spider rampaged through the Colonies and the Empire. Some tried to stop them, but their brutal techniques too often proved superior. - Otomo Hiroshi, The Final Days, third scroll
designernotes: A Spider Duelist breaking his opponent weapon as he try to parry.

text: Iaijutsu Battle: Your target unbowed Personality challenges a target enemy Personality. Give the loser -2F and dishonor him. If you won, you may take an additional action which may not target enemy cards other than the loser.
title: Strike of the Obsidian Blade

flavor: The snap of breaking metal was like a bell's chime. "Your weapon, like you, is inadequate," Toshigure said. "Speak to me of my clan's shortcomings again and see yourself broken as well."

text: Iaijutsu Battle: Target your unbowed Personality. Bow a target enemy attachment. Destroy it if your Personality is a Duelist and his Chi is greater than or equal to the attachment's Force.
title: Sundered Blade

flavor: Before the first word could leave the Spider's mouth, Kinshikirai's blade pinned his scroll-hand to the wall. "Now, Spider, let us discuss the punishment for treason."

text: Interrupt: Bow your target unbowed Weapon to negate its Personality's destruction from the action and, if he is a Kensai and has two Weapons, to negate his movement and bowing from it. Destroy the Weapon.
title: Swifter than Sight

flavor: "The ashigaru broke the moment the Spider reserves appeared. The Imperials should have known not to rely on peasant levies." - Akodo Dairuko
designernotes: Ashigaru and other conscripted troops break and flee in terror before a dark and omnious army.

text:
Your Melee Attacks have +1 strength. Other players' Melee Attacks have -1 strength.
Battle/Engage: Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play.
title: Terrorizing Ambush

flavor: "Sanity? Tactics? Who needs those? Bwahahahaha!!!"
designernotes: A Bitter Lies kensai with a fearsomemask attacking in a crazy, ridiculously over the top way his opponents, who flee.

text:
As a Focus Effect, after this duel resolves, put this card into your hand if you lost.
Battle: Bow your target unbowed Personality. Move home a target enemy unit with fewer attachments or with lower Force than your Personality. Straighten your Personality if he has two Weapons attached.
title: The Dark Sword's Lunacy

flavor: "The nature of this man's crimes justifies the manner of his arrest, Kitsuki-sama. He does not deserve the courtesy afforded to others of his rank."
designernotes: Art: [Ikoma Detective] in a Magistrate office, having caught his man. Other magistrates from a variety of clans look on in approval, as if this Scorpion was a good catch.

text: Battle: Target your unbowed Personality. Give a target enemy Personality a Force penalty equal to your Personality's Chi or the number of your Magistrates in his army, whichever is higher.
title: The Indignity of Arrest

flavor: "Those beasts have never been seen this far into our borders. How did they get here?" - Hida Kisada

text:
You may only play one The Looming Darkness per turn.
Open: Either give all Shadowlands Personalities +1F/+1C or give all non-Shadowlands Personalities a minimum of 1 Chi and -1F/-1C. Lose 2 Honor.
title: The Looming Darkness

flavor: Saeki swept Oneiyara's legs out from under him, sending him spiraling into the dirt. "Do you think you are better than the peasants? That you mean any more than they do? They know the honor of service! You are nothing more than a bandit!"
designernotes: A Shinjo magistrate catching a criminal, immobilizing him.

text: Battle: Give a target enemy Personality -3F. Dishonor him if he now has 0 Force.
title: The Price of Shame

flavor: "I am privileged to serve in this capacity. My efforts shall restore prosperity to the Empire and Colonies alike." - Doji Dainagon

text:
Invest :g2:: If the target is Crane Clan or an Artisan, draw a card.
Open: Permanently give your target Personality the ability, "Dynasty/Open, :bow:: Discard a card to produce Gold equal to its Focus Value."
title: Turquoise Adjunct

flavor: "I may die, but I will not be a coward. In the next life, my soul will find better means."
designernotes: An ashigaru bracing himself to withstand a samurai charge.

text:
Discipline :g0:. (Pay 0 Gold to play, then remove from the game, this Discipline in your discard.)
Battle: Straighten your target card that was bowed by another player's card effect this battle.
title: Unexpected Valor

flavor: "That is it! That overgrown cockroach has crossed the final line! Kyuden Bayushi will burn for what he's done! I will anoint my blade with his arterial spray and drown his family in his blood!"
designernotes: Dairuko swears she will level Kyuden Bayushi for Nitoshi freeing demons onto her army.

text: Battle: Take two additional actions. Strategies discarded by any of these additional actions that is Tactical Advantage permanently gain Discipline :g1:. You may not target other players or their cards until after their next opportunity to take a Battle action.
title: Unforgivable

flavor: "And I say the Taint has returned! You think you can call a Crab a liar?" - Hida Zaiberu
designernotes: Art: Hida Zaiberu flipping a table at a sake bar, as other patrons recoil in disgust.

text: Battle: Target your Personality and an enemy Personality with lower Force. Give your Personality a Force bonus equal to the difference, to a maximum of +5F.
title: Unseemly Brawl

flavor: He frowned and shook his head, trying to clear his mind. The shot seemed perfect, but at the same time something seemed terribly wrong.
use: Strong Card with Honor loss to self
designernotes: A Goblin Chucker hitting his mark.

text:
Battle: Straighten a target card with a Melee or Ranged Attack ability. Lose 2 Honor.
Interrupt: If the action has a Melee or Ranged Attack, give it +2 strength. Lose 2 Honor.
title: Unwanted Tutelage

flavor: Honor transcends the waxing and waning of politics. The Crane remain dedicated to ensuring that improper conduct is met with appropriate consequence.
designernotes: A samurai strengthened in battle by their purity.

text: Battle: Give your target opposed Personality +2F. You may target an enemy Personality with lower Personal Honor; if you do, give him -2F and gain 1 Honor.
title: Virtuous Victory

flavor: "There are riddles of the world so much greater than the piddling nonsense most men concern themselves with." - Togashi Noburo

text: Water Absent Battle: Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play. If he would be opposed, move your target Personality at any location to this battlefield. You may straighten the Ring of Water.
title: Walking with the Water

flavor: An army protecting lands that have been prepared for war is difficult to assail.
designernotes: Archers shooting down from a wall.

text:
Siege Interrupt: If you have a Fortification at the current battlefield, negate an Engage action.
Siege Battle: Bow your target unbowed Fortification. Ranged Attack equal to half its Gold Cost, rounded up, plus 1.
title: Walls of Death

flavor: "Perfect attunement is possible, if exceedingly difficult. Master your chi, and the fire will respond to your every thought."
designernotes: Notes: A monk meditating upon a roaring fire.

text: Kiho Battle/Open: Bow your target unbowed Monk or Shugenja. Search your Fate discard pile, then deck, for a Ring. Show it and put it in your hand.
title: Aligned with Fire

flavor: With the Lion advancing relentlessly, the Scorpion use every advantage in their dwindling arsenal.
designernotes: Archers on Higher Ground

text:
Your Ranged Attacks have +1 strength. Other players' Ranged Attacks have -1 strength.
Battle/Engage: Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play.
title: Archer's Position

flavor: A mountain can never conceive of its own fall.
designernotes: A samurai killing a member of the Spider in the Shinomen forest battle.

text:
Invest :g2:: The winner also destroys a card without attachments in the loser's unit, and gains 1 Honor if this destroyed an attachment.
Iaijutsu Battle: Your target unbowed Personality challenges a target enemy Personality. Bow the loser.
title: Avenge Your Slights

flavor: "Three against one and still unequal to the task!"
designernotes: Notes: A basic interrupt action for the favor. Good for draft.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
Discipline :g3: or :g0: if you are the Defender.
Battle: If there are enemy units at this battlefield, move your target Personality there from home. If the target moved to defend, straighten him or her.
title: Battlefield Defamation

flavor:
"Over there, my lord. Look closely. I think you may be in danger."
"Look at what? What are you talking abo- URK!"
designernotes: A Scorpion ninja killing a Lion soldier from the shadows.

text: Assassin Open, :g10:: Destroy a target Personality with 3 or lower Chi. Lose Honor equal to half your Starting Family Honor, rounded up.
title: Betrayed from Within

flavor: "The Scorpion have forgotten why all clans fear the Lion!" Dairuko's blade sundered her opponent. She raised it high. "Remind them!" she commanded. "Remind them!"
designernotes: Matsu killing a Scorpion.

text:
Battle/Open: A target player may only put one more Ring into play this turn.
Battle: Melee 3 Attack, which may not target a Defending Personality. Give your target Personality Resilient. (Once per game per card, a Resilient card does not die in battle resolution.)
title: Cleaving the Wave

flavor: "Get up! Do you want to die kneeling like a peasant?"
designernotes: A wounded Samurai rising up from the ground, ready to fight again.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
Battle: Straighten your target opposed card.
title: Die on Your Feet

flavor: Dairuko's advance systematically dismantled the Scorpion's defenders. Like the rising of an ocean tide, there was just no stopping it.
designernotes: A Scorpion Samurai on the battlefield falls to the ground, one hand raised over his eyes. Akodo Dairuko stands over them, her sword raised to strike.

text: Battle: Target your unbowed Personality. Reduce a target enemy Follower's or Personality's Force by your Personality's Personal Honor. If that Personal Honor is 4 or more, Ranged 0 Attack against the enemy target (if legal).
title: Disciplined Advance

flavor: The tradition of taryu-jiai pits two shugenja against one another in ritual combat. Such battles can be as beautiful as winter sunsets… and terrible as midnight thunder.
designernotes: Art: A Moto Death Priest and Isawa shugenja having an all-out wizard duel, with magical energy everywhere. The troops that they are supposed to be supporting are fleeing in terror, some of which are getting hit by the splash damage of the attacks.

text:
At this battlefield, Personalities without attachments have -1F, and your Shugenja with Spells have +1F/+1C.
Battle: Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play.
title: Duel of Shugenja

flavor: The bandit fell to his knees. He had some fight left, but what was the point now?
designernotes: Kitsuki Kojak (in this set) threatening a criminal with a bow.

text:
Disciplne :g3:.
Battle: Dishonor a target enemy Personality.
Battle: Fear 3 that may target Items. After this bows a card in a dishonorable Personality's unit, destroy that card.
title: Ending the Chase

flavor: "Excellent form, but watch how your weight shifts. Again!"
designernotes: Lions soldiers practicing military tactics.

text:
This card's Interrupt ability costs :g0: if it Interrupts the Tactical Advantage ability.
Open: Put this Kata into play. Discard your other Kata in play.
Interrupt, :bow:, :g1:: After the Battle action discards a card from your hand, draw a card.
title: Endless Drills

flavor: "I have no time for this!"
designernotes: Notes: A Masked Ninja in the shadows, sneaking behind an enemy.

text:
Compassion: Discipline :g2:. (Compassion takes effect while you have fewer Provinces than anyone else. Pay 2 Gold to play, then remove from the game, this Discipline in your discard.)
Battle: Move home your target Personality, who must be opposed if defending. As the target moves, straighten his or her unit and draw a card.
title: Evasion

flavor: A true warrior does not acknowledge disadvantage.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard a Courage card to give a Fear effect +2 or -2 strength or discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
This card has +2FV during a duel in which you were challenged, or during an action that discarded it from your hand.
title: Fight on Your Back

flavor: "You've spent too much time in the dojo, my friend. And I'm afraid it shows."

text: Battle, :g*:: Target your unbowed Personality. If the target is Kensai, you may Equip a target Weapon from your discard pile to him or her. You may target and move home an enemy Personality with fewer Weapons.
title: Fighting Unrestrained

flavor: "You are responsible," she whispered hoarsely. "I do not care what they whisper in court. I do not care what your lord says."
designernotes: [Art Note: A Magistrate, choosing to end a scumbag's life instead of seeing him go through the court system.]

text: Battle: Target your unbowed Personality. Fear equal to his or her Chi that may target Items and Spells. If your Personality is a Magistrate and the Personality in the enemy target's unit is dishonorable or Shadowlands, the Fear destroys cards after bowing them. Bow your Personality if this destroyed a Personality.
title: Illegal Justice

flavor: "Yes, yes, the prophecy. When was the last time there was not a prophecy of doom hanging over our heads?"
designernotes: Notes: Meh about the prophecy…

text:
As a Focus Effect, before a card is destroyed for losing the duel, bow it instead.
Battle: Move home a target Personality with no attachments or with three or more attachments.
title: Indifference

flavor: "In the forest," Tetsuo said. "The First Seal is there."
designernotes: The dark, terrifying Shinomen forest. Give a sinister vibe.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard a Courage card to give a Fear effect +2 or -2 strength.)
After you announce a Courage action, give a target enemy Follower or Personality -2F.
Battle/Engage: Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play.
title: Into the Shinomen

flavor: The war-shout of an honorable Matsu can freeze the blood.
designernotes: An honorable Lion fighting a dishonorable Scorpion. ORIGINAL!

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
Battle: Fear equal to the Personal Honor of your target unbowed Personality. After this bows a card in a unit whose Personality has lower Personal Honor, give your Personality +2F.
title: Matsu Ki-Ai

flavor: "Let me prove it to you."
designernotes: Notes: A massive Duelist showing no mercy to his opponent.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
Iaijutsu Battle: Target your unbowed Personality and target an enemy Personality with equal or higher Chi. Bow a card in the enemy unit without attachments, or any card in that unit if your Personality is a Duelist. Gain 1 Honor if you are the Defender.
title: My Steel is Stronger

flavor: Goichi looked at the blood, the torn screens, the general state of disrepair throughout the chamber. "Most of this was done after the fact," he stated, "to incite horror and obscure the true nature of the crime."
designernotes: Art: Kitsuki Goichi (20F Soul of Kitsuki Barii) investigating a murder scene. There are clear signs of a struggle and various bloodstains, but no body.

text: Battle: Fear 3. If one of your Magistrates has been destroyed this battle, the Fear has +1 strength and may target a Personality with attached Followers.
title: Mysterious Murder

flavor: "We cannot kill it, brothers. We can only slow it down enough for our kinsmen to escape. Who rides with me?"
designernotes: A commander orders his men into a hopeless engagement in order to gain a larger strategic advantage.

text: Battle: Bow your target unbowed Follower. Target a Battle Strategy in your discard pile with a lower Focus Value than your Follower's Force, and put it into your hand. Take an additional action if your Follower is attached to a Commander.
title: Necessary Sacrifice

flavor:
"No Miya must know we were here,"
he whispered. "I do not wish to kill an Imperial if it can be avoided."
designernotes: A swarm of Goju emerging from the shadows to grasp unwitting samurai who are hunting the Spider.

text:
This card's ability costs 1 less Gold for each of your Ninja at this battlefield with non-zero Gold Cost.
Ninja Battle, :g4:: If they would be opposed, create two 2F/2C/0PH Ninja Personalities with your Clan Alignment, and with Shadowlands if you are Spider Clan. Lose 3 Honor. Remove them from the game before the turn ends.
title: Ninja Training Exercise

flavor: "This world is merely the culmination of every person's kharma." - Mirumoto Shikei
designernotes: [Art Note: The Dragon being weird and doing weird things, and later we will find out there is relevance]

text:
Open: Put this Kata into play. Discard your other Kata in play without this card's title.
Open, :bow:, :g3:: Put your target Ring from your hand into play; while it remains in play, it does not count towards an Enlightenment Victory. Put it into your hand after your next turn begins.
title: Opening the Heart's Door

flavor: Lion forces are able to break the very terrain itself.
designernotes: The Lion press forward in a huge battle at Kyuden Bayushi.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
Your Personalities have +1F for each bowed card type in units opposing them.
Battle: Destroy a Terrain (if able). Put this Terrain into play.
title: Phalanx Formation

flavor: "We cannot risk another breach around the Second Pit."
designernotes: [Art Note: Kyuden Bayushi prepares for the siege from Dairuko]

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
Siege Open: If you control at least three Personalities, straighten one or two of your target Fortifications. If this straightened two Fortifications, they will not produce Gold this turn.
title: Repairing the Walls

flavor: "What is it? What am I missing?"
designernotes: A stressed out commander, his head in his hands, surrounded by piles of maps and orders and reports.

text:
(Repeatable Interrupt: Discard an Honor card to give an Honor gain or loss +1 or -1.)
Courtesy: The Force penalty is increased by 1. (Courtesy does not take effect if you went first. Absent actions may be taken without presence.)
Battle: Give a target enemy Personality a Force penalty equal to his or her Chi.
title: Retracing Steps

flavor: "You think I'm like you? Only able to fight with my right hand?"
designernotes: A Samurai who switches his blade from one hand to the other after getting wounded on the arm.

text: Open: Target your Personality with exactly one Weapon. Permanently give him or her the trait, "May not attach more than one Weapon," and permanently give the Weapon the ability, "Battle, :bow:: Melee 3 Attack. If this Weapon is attached to a Kensai, straighten it."
title: Scorpion Flexibility

flavor: The Lion Champion swore she would burn Kyuden Bayushi to the ground for the Scorpion's insult. The Scorpion intended to make her pay for the privilege.
designernotes: [Art note: The Scorpion armies are trying to protect Kyuden Bayushi.]

text:
Discipline :g2:. (Pay 2 Gold to play, then remove from the game, this Discipline in your discard.)
Battle: Give this Province +3 strength. Personalities may not enter play this battle.
title: Secretive Defense

flavor: "Disguise yourself as Mantis to deflect suspicion. We must find every scroll that mentions these Seals." - Bayushi Nitoshi
designernotes: Art: [Shosuro Spy] in the office of a Mantis Samurai going through assorted documents. Unconscious on the ground is his target, wearing a similar outfit to what [Shosuro Spy] has in his personality art.

text: Ninja Open: Target your unbowed Ninja Personality and another Personality with a Poison token or without abilities. Your Ninja copies the Personality's printed Force, Chi, and abilities that do not copy abilities. Lose 1 Honor.
title: Stealing the Scrolls

flavor: "Focus your strength on the enemy's weakness, and you will always succeed." - Sun Tao
designernotes: Art: A group of Unicorn cavalry running down some ill-equipped Ashigaru troops, trampling over them with no difficulty.

text: Battle: Bow your target unbowed Follower. Destroy a target enemy attachment with equal or lower Force. If your Follower is attached to a Commander, you may either straighten the Follower, or target and bow an attachment in the same enemy unit with equal or lower Force than your Follower.
title: Superior Assault

flavor: "She said she'd torch this place," whispered Nitoshi. "I won't give her the satisfaction."
designernotes: Exploiting the phrasing of the Lion Champion's vow to burn down Kyuden Bayushi, the Scorpion evacuate and burn it themselves to deny the Lion their righteous vengeance.

text: Battle: Destroy your target Fortification at the current battlefield to move home a target enemy Personality. Bow his unit as he moves. Gain 1 Honor.
title: The Fall of Kyuden Bayushi

flavor: Hida warriors do not often strike first in a duel. But sometimes they win all the same.
designernotes: A Spider duelist cutting short a Crab just before its Tetsubo killed him.

text:
As a Focus Effect, give this card +1FV if it was the last card you focused in the duel.
Iaijutsu Battle: Your target unbowed Personality challenges another player's target Personality. Give the winner +3F.
title: The Last Strike

flavor: "We must seek the hidden to protect the future."
designernotes: The Dragon being very mysterious and quirky. Only later will we find out the significance of what they are doing.

text:
Invest :g2:: If the target is Void, draw a card. (Upon being played, permanently increase the Gold Cost by the Invest cost to get the effect.)
Void Kiho Battle/Open: Target your unbowed Monk or Shugenja. Search your Fate deck for a card, set it aside face-down, and put it on top of the deck after shuffling.
title: The Search for Enlightenment

flavor: A true samurai cannot be beaten, only killed… and his soul will return.
designernotes: Art: A two Crab Samurai and former Spider Monk fighting back to back against a mass of Shadowlands beasts and Spider troops. They are outnumbered and "outgunned," but desperation means they have to trust each other and work together in order to survive.

text: Interrupt: If another player has resolved two or more actions this turn that reduced any of your Human cards' Force, negate all future Force penalties (including any this is Interrupting) to your Human cards from that player's actions until this battle ends.
title: Unbreakable Courage

flavor: Some disgraces cannot be erased. Some shames cannot be forgiven.
designernotes: A dishonored Samurai committing seppuku. His shame is such that he doesn't have a second to assist him.

text:
Discipline :g2:.
Political Open: Bow your target unbowed Courtier. Reduce a target Personality's Force by your Courtier's Chi. If the Personality is dishonorable, his or her controller loses 1 Honor.
title: Unforgivable Shame

flavor: "It is too bad you did not take Akodo's lessons to heart."
designernotes: A Scorpion Samurai impales a Lion samurai with his katana from behind.

text:
Compassion: The Melee Attack has +2 strength. (Compassion takes effect while you have fewer Provinces than anyone else.)
Battle: Melee 1 Attack that may target Items and Spells and has +2 strength if the target is an attachment.
title: Unguarded Attack

flavor: Yuhmi moved with purpose in absolute silence, severing the Master of Earth's hand, then his entire arm.
use: Strong Card with Honor loss to self
designernotes: A Horde of Shadowlands monsters attack a group of Crabs, Mantis, and Phoenix at the First Seal. We can clearly see Isawa Norimichi being struck down.

text: Battle: Fear 3. After this bows the target, destroy it if it has 2 or lower Force. (Bow a target enemy Follower or Personality without Followers with 3 or lower Force) Lose 2 Honor.
title: Unshackled

flavor: "Is it snowing? I had not noticed."
designernotes: Notes: Trying to tie in the Ring of Air based upon the title of the card.

text:
You must discard the Imperial Favor and give this Strategy's ability Favor Political to play it using Discipline.
Discipline :g0:.
Battle/Open: Bow your target unbowed Ring. Straighten one or two of your target cards in units.
title: Walking with the Air

flavor: The mind must be conditioned just as the body, for it carries far heavier forms of weight.
designernotes: Art: Komori Taruko packing her bags to leave for an important mission. Arranged on shelves and around her room are heaps of spell scrolls and trinkets, but there is no way she can fit all of them for travel. She looks befuddled at how she could possibly carry everything she wants.

text:
Open: Put this Kata into play. Discard your other Kata in play.
Open, :bow:: Put the top card of your Fate deck under this Kata (face-down but you may look at it).
Open, :bow:, :g3:: Put a card underneath this Kata into your hand.
title: Wisdom's Burden

flavor: The sacred incantations crumbled to dust. Never before had Renyu seen such blasphemy.
designernotes: [Art Note: A Shadowlands Oni destroying the scroll satchel of a Phoenix Shugenja at the Battle for the First Seal.]

text:
This action costs 3 less Gold if you have Courtesy or if it only targets one attachment.
Battle, :g*:: Destroy one or two target enemy attachments with total Gold Cost equal to the amount paid; if you target two attachments they must be in the same unit, which must have at least three attachments.
title: Without Your Weapons

flavor: "I speak for the Son of Heaven."
designernotes: The Otomo exert their political power and authority.

text:
You must discard the Imperial Favor and give this Strategy's ability Favor Political to play it using Discipline.
Discipline :g0:.
Political Battle: Fear equal to your target Courtier's Chi. A target player gains or loses 1 Honor.
title: Word from the Imperial Court

flavor: It was hubris to believe that Jigoku could ever be tamed. Over two decades, the Empire had forgotten the taint. It was exactly what the Shadowlands wanted.
designernotes: The revelation that the taint was only hidden, not removed.

text: Open: Target your Human non-Shadowlands Personality. You reveal the corruption within. Permanently give the target Shadowlands and the ability, "Battle: Fear 4," and give him or her a +1F token. Lose 3 Honor.
title: Your True Colors
